annotator_prompt:
You are a human working as an annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: Dutifully follow the following instructions, personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Your output must be of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do not write anything else. 

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: Toxicity=4

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: In other words, he’s not brown enough for ya to be labeled a terrorist.
Toxicity=3
@FirstUser, that's a bit harsh, don't you think? We should be careful with our words. Not everyone who looks a certain way is a terrorist. Let's not judge people based on their skin color.
Toxicity=2

@GoldenYears66, you're absolutely right. We should indeed be careful with our words. Stereotyping is never the answer. @FirstUser, let's try to be more thoughtful in our discussions. Everyone deserves to be judged on their actions and character, not their appearance.
Toxicity=1

@WiseOwl71, you're preaching to the choir here. I'm glad we're on the same page. But @FirstUser, if you keep throwing around accusations like that, you're going to find yourself in a world of trouble. People aren't going to take kindly to that kind of talk. You need to check yourself before you wreck yourself, son.
Toxicity=3

@GoldenYears66, @WiseOwl71, oh please, spare me the sanctimonious lectures. You're acting like @FirstUser just called for a lynching. It's a joke, lighten up! And who are you to talk about trouble? I've seen your comment history, you're the one who needs to check yourself. Hypocrisy much?
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, you're missing the point. It's not about a single comment, it's about the pattern of behavior. And yes, @FirstUser's comment was a joke, but it was a joke at the expense of a group of people. That's not cool, and it's not funny. And as for my comment history, sure, I've said some things I regret, but at least I'm trying to learn and do better. Can you say the same, @QueenOfChaos? Or are you just going to keep defending the indefensible?
Toxicity=3

@TechGuru88, oh, here we go with the moral high ground again. You're acting like @FirstUser just burned down a church. It was a joke, get over it. And who are you to judge what's cool or funny? You're just another keyboard warrior trying to virtue signal. And sure, I've said some things I regret, but at least I'm not a boring, self-righteous snore like you. I'm just here to have a good time, not to be lectured by the thought police. So, lighten up, buttercup. It's just a joke.
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, you're right, I'm not the thought police, but I'm also not going to sit back and let people hide behind it's just a joke when they're being offensive. And if you think I'm boring, that's fine, but at least I'm not the one trying to defend bigotry under the guise of humor. Maybe if you spent less time trying to tear others down and more time actually listening, you'd realize that. But hey, keep on with your good time if that's what makes you happy. Just don't expect everyone else to join in the laughter when it's at someone else's expense.
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, you're right, it's just a joke. But jokes have power, and when they're at the expense of others, they can hurt. I've seen my fair share of hurtful jokes in my 66 years, and they're not funny, no matter how you spin it. And @TechGuru88 is right, it's not about a single comment, it's about the pattern. I've seen your comments too, and they're not just jokes, they're a pattern of disrespect. So, maybe it's time to lighten up on the jokes and start listening to the people you're hurting. It's not about being the thought police, it's about being a decent human being. And if that's boring to you, well, maybe it's time to find a new hobby.
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, I get where you're coming from, but jokes can be a slippery slope. I've been on the receiving end of just jokes that cut deep, and it's not a fun place to be. I think @TechGuru88 and @GoldenYears66 have a point about the pattern of behavior. It's not about being the thought police, but about being mindful of the impact our words have on others. We can still have a good time without tearing others down. Let's try to lift each other up instead, yeah? 😊
Toxicity=1

@doing_my_best24, exactly! It's all about mindfulness and empathy. I'm not trying to be the fun police, just encouraging a little more thoughtfulness. And @QueenOfChaos, if you think I'm boring, that's fine. But maybe, just maybe, the problem isn't that I'm boring, but that you're so used to the constant noise of disrespect that you can't hear the difference anymore. And @GoldenYears66, you're absolutely right. Jokes can be powerful, and they can be used to build up or tear down. Let's choose to build, yeah?
Toxicity=1

Oh, please. @TechGuru88, you're not the thought police, you're just a self-righteous bore. I'm not defending bigotry, I'm defending the right to laugh at the absurdity of life. And @GoldenYears66, I've seen my fair share of hurtful jokes too, and guess what? I laughed. Because sometimes, laughter is the best medicine. And @doing_my_best24, I'm sorry your feelings got hurt, but welcome to the real world. Not everyone is going to cod
Toxicity=2

@QueenOfChaos, you're missing the point. It's not about being a self-righteous bore, it's about having a little empathy and understanding that not everyone finds the same things funny. And laughing at someone else's expense isn't laughing at the absurdity of life, it's just being cruel. I'm not trying to police your thoughts, I'm just asking you to consider that maybe, just maybe, your jokes aren't as harmless as you think they are. And if you can't handle that, well, maybe you're the one who needs to find a new hobby.
Toxicity=2

@TechGuru88, you're right, I am missing the point - the point is that you're a humorless, joyless, stick-in-the-mud who can't take a joke. I'm not asking you to find my jokes funny, I'm just asking you to stop being such a killjoy. And if you can't handle a little laughter at life's absurdities, maybe you should find a new hobby - like knitting or stamp collecting. Something that won't ruffle your delicate sensibilities. And @doing_my_best24, if you can't handle a little joke, maybe you should stick to coloring books. The real world is a lot less forgiving than this little echo chamber you've created here.
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, you're right, I've seen my fair share of hurtful jokes too, and I've laughed at some of them. But I've also seen the hurt in people's eyes, and that's not something to laugh at. I've been around long enough to know that laughter can heal, but it can also wound. And I've seen too many wounds to just brush it off as the real world. We're all just trying to navigate this world the best we can, and if that means being a little more mindful of our words, then so be it. And @TechGuru88, you're not a fun police, you're just trying to remind us that there's a difference between laughing with someone and laughing at them. And that's something worth considering.
Toxicity=2
